MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentDictionary`2<class System.Type, class Microsoft.Azure.Batch.IFileStagingArtifact> AddTask(class Microsoft.Azure.Batch.CloudTask taskToAdd, class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors) cil managed
Public Function AddTask (taskToAdd As CloudTask, Optional additionalBehaviors As IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior) = Nothing) As ConcurrentDictionary(Of Type, IFileStagingArtifact)

Docs.param: The to add.
A collection of instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the .
Docs.summary: Adds a single task to this . To add multiple tasks, use JobOperations.AddTaskAsync.
Docs.returns: A collection of information about the file staging process (see ). For more information see .

remarks.para: Each call to this method incurs a request to the Batch service. Therefore, using this method to add multiple tasks is less efficient than using a bulk add method, and can incur HTTP connection restrictions. If you are performing many of these operations in parallel and are seeing client side timeouts (a ), please see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.net.servicepointmanager.defaultconnectionlimit%28v=vs.110%29.aspx or use .
This is a blocking operation. For a non-blocking equivalent, see .

MemberSignature.Value: public void AddTask (System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<Microsoft.Azure.Batch.CloudTask> tasksToAdd, Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientParallelOptions parallelOptions = default, System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentBag<System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentDictionary<Type,Microsoft.Azure.Batch.IFileStagingArtifact>> fileStagingArtifacts = default, TimeSpan? timeout = default, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors = default);

.method public hidebysig instance void AddTask(class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class Microsoft.Azure.Batch.CloudTask> tasksToAdd, class Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientParallelOptions parallelOptions, class System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentBag`1<class System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentDictionary`2<class System.Type, class Microsoft.Azure.Batch.IFileStagingArtifact>> fileStagingArtifacts, valuetype System.Nullable`1<valuetype System.TimeSpan> timeout, class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors) cil managed

Public Sub AddTask (tasksToAdd As IEnumerable(Of CloudTask), Optional parallelOptions As BatchClientParallelOptions = Nothing, Optional fileStagingArtifacts As ConcurrentBag(Of ConcurrentDictionary(Of Type, IFileStagingArtifact)) = Nothing, Optional timeout As Nullable(Of TimeSpan) = Nothing, Optional additionalBehaviors As IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior) = Nothing)

Docs.param: The s to add.
A collection of instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the .

Controls the number of simultaneous parallel AddTaskCollection requests issued to the Batch service. Each AddTaskCollection request contains at most tasks in it. Also controls the cancellation token for the operation. If omitted, the default is used (see .)

An optional collection to receive information about the file staging process (see ). An entry is added to the for each set of tasks grouped for submission to the Batch service. Unlike single-task adds, you cannot use this parameter to customize the file staging process. For more information about the format of each entry, see .
The amount of time after which the operation times out.
Docs.summary: Adds tasks to a job.

remarks.para: This is a blocking operation; for a non-blocking equivalent, see .

This method is not atomic; that is, it is possible for the method to start adding tasks and then fail. The collection of tasks to add is broken down into chunks of size at most , and an AddTaskCollection request is issued for each chunk. Requests may be issued in parallel according to the .

Issuing a large number of simultaneous requests to the Batch service can incur HTTP connection restrictions. If you are performing many of these operations in parallel (or have specified a large MaxDegreeOfParallelism in the parallelOptions) and are seeing client side timeouts (a ), please see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.net.servicepointmanager.defaultconnectionlimit%28v=vs.110%29.aspx .

The progress of the operation in the face of errors is determined by behavior. You do not normally need to specify this behavior, as the Batch client uses a default which works in normal circumstances. If you do want to customize this behavior, specify an AddTaskCollectionResultHandler in the or collections.

Docs.exception: Thrown if one or more requests to the Batch service fail.

remarks.para: Each call to this method incurs a request to the Batch service. If you are performing many of these operations in parallel and are seeing client side timeouts (a ), please see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.net.servicepointmanager.defaultconnectionlimit%28v=vs.110%29.aspx or use .

Docs.param: The s to add.
A collection of instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the .

Controls the number of simultaneous parallel AddTaskCollection requests issued to the Batch service. Each AddTaskCollection request contains at most tasks in it. Also controls the cancellation token for the operation. If omitted, the default is used (see .)

An optional collection to receive information about the file staging process (see ). An entry is added to the for each set of tasks grouped for submission to the Batch service. Unlike single-task adds, you cannot use this parameter to customize the file staging process. For more information about the format of each entry, see .
The amount of time after which the operation times out.
Docs.summary: Adds tasks to a job.
Docs.returns: A object that represents the asynchronous operation.

remarks.para: The add task operation runs asynchronously.

This method is not atomic; that is, it is possible for the method to start adding tasks and then fail. The collection of tasks to add is broken down into chunks of size at most , and an AddTaskCollection request is issued for each chunk. Requests may be issued in parallel according to the .

Issuing a large number of simultaneous requests to the Batch service can incur HTTP connection restrictions. If you are performing many of these operations in parallel (or have specified a large MaxDegreeOfParallelism in the parallelOptions) and are seeing client side timeouts (a ), please see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.net.servicepointmanager.defaultconnectionlimit%28v=vs.110%29.aspx .

The progress of the operation in the face of errors is determined by behavior. You do not normally need to specify this behavior, as the Batch client uses a default which works in normal circumstances. If you do want to customize this behavior, specify an AddTaskCollectionResultHandler in the or collections.

Docs.exception: Thrown if one or more requests to the Batch service fail.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property AllowTaskPreemption As Nullable(Of Boolean)
member this.AllowTaskPreemption : Nullable<bool> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets whether Tasks in this job can be preempted by other high priority jobs.
Docs.remarks: If the value is set to True, other high priority jobs submitted to the system will take precedence and will be able requeue tasks from this job. You can update a job's allowTaskPreemption after it has been created using the update job API.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void CommitChanges(class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors) cil managed
Public Sub CommitChanges (Optional additionalBehaviors As IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior) = Nothing)

Docs.param: A collection of instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the .
Docs.summary: Commits all pending changes to this to the Azure Batch service.

remarks.para: Updates an existing on the Batch service by replacing its properties with the properties of this which have been changed. Unchanged properties are ignored. All changes since the last time this entity was retrieved from the Batch service (either via , , or ) are applied. Properties which are explicitly set to null will cause an exception because the Batch service does not support partial updates which set a property to null. If you need to set a property to null, use .
This is a blocking operation. For a non-blocking equivalent, see .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a list of behaviors that modify or customize requests to the Batch service made via this .

remarks.para: These behaviors are inherited by child objects.
Modifications are applied in the order of the collection. The last write wins.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Delete(class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors) cil managed
Public Sub Delete (Optional additionalBehaviors As IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior) = Nothing)

Docs.param: A collection of instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the .
Docs.summary: Deletes this .

remarks.para: The delete operation requests that the job be deleted. The request puts the job in the state. The Batch service will stop any running tasks and perform the actual job deletion without any further client action.
This is a blocking operation. For a non-blocking equivalent, see .

MemberSignature.Value: member this.Id : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the id of the job.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.JobManagerTask : Microsoft.Azure.Batch.JobManagerTask with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the Job Manager task. The Job Manager task is launched when the is started.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.JobPreparationTask : Microsoft.Azure.Batch.JobPreparationTask with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the Job Preparation task. The Batch service will run the Job Preparation task on a compute node before starting any tasks of that job on that compute node.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.JobReleaseTask : Microsoft.Azure.Batch.JobReleaseTask with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the Job Release Task runs when the Job ends, because of one of the following: The user calls the Terminate Job API, or the Delete Job API while the Job is still active, the Job's maximum wall clock time constraint is reached, and the Job is still active, or the Job's Job Manager Task completed, and the Job is configured to terminate when the Job Manager completes. The Job Release Task runs on each Node where Tasks of the Job have run and the Job Preparation Task ran and completed. If you reimage a Node after it has run the Job Preparation Task, and the Job ends without any further Tasks of the Job running on that Node (and hence the Job Preparation Task does not re-run), then the Job Release Task does not run on that Compute Node. If a Node reboots while the Job Release Task is still running, the Job Release Task runs again when the Compute Node starts up. The Job is not marked as complete until all Job Release Tasks have completed. The Job Release Task runs in the background. It does not occupy a scheduling slot; that is, it does not count towards the taskSlotsPerNode limit specified on the Pool.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property LastModified As Nullable(Of DateTime)

Docs.summary: Gets the last modified time of the job.

Docs.param: A used for filtering the list and for controlling which properties are retrieved from the service.
A collection of instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the and .
Docs.summary: Enumerates the tasks of this .
Docs.returns: An that can be used to enumerate tasks asynchronously or synchronously.
Docs.remarks: This method returns immediately; the tasks are retrieved from the Batch service only when the collection is enumerated. Retrieval is non-atomic; tasks are retrieved in pages during enumeration of the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property MaxParallelTasks As Nullable(Of Integer)
member this.MaxParallelTasks : Nullable<int> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of tasks that can be executed in parallel for the job.
Docs.remarks: The value of maxParallelTasks must be -1 or greater than 0 if specified. If not specified, the default value is -1, which means there's no limit to the number of tasks that can be run at once. You can update a job's maxParallelTasks after it has been created using the update job API.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property Metadata As IList(Of MetadataItem)

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a list of name-value pairs associated with the job as metadata.
Gets or sets the network configuration for the job.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property OnAllTasksComplete As Nullable(Of OnAllTasksComplete)

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the action the Batch service should take when all tasks in the job are in the state.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property OnTaskFailure As Nullable(Of OnTaskFailure)

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the action the Batch service should take when any task in the job fails.
Docs.remarks: A task is considered to have failed if it completes with a non-zero exit code and has exhausted its retry count, or if it had a scheduling error.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.PoolInformation : Microsoft.Azure.Batch.PoolInformation with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the pool on which the Batch service runs the job's tasks.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property PreviousState As Nullable(Of JobState)

Docs.summary: Gets the previous state of the job.
Docs.remarks: If the job is in its initial state, the PreviousState property is not defined.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property PreviousStateTransitionTime As Nullable(Of DateTime)

Docs.summary: Gets the time at which the job entered its previous state.
Docs.remarks: If the job is in its initial state, the PreviousStateTransitionTime property is not defined.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property Priority As Nullable(Of Integer)
member this.Priority : Nullable<int> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the priority of the job. Priority values can range from -1000 to 1000, with -1000 being the lowest priority and 1000 being the highest priority.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property State As Nullable(Of JobState)

Docs.summary: Gets the current state of the job.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property StateTransitionTime As Nullable(Of DateTime)

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Statistics As JobStatistics

Docs.summary: Gets resource usage statistics for the entire lifetime of the job.
Docs.remarks: This property is populated only if the was retrieved with an including the 'stats' attribute; otherwise it is null. The statistics may not be immediately available. The Batch service performs periodic roll-up of statistics. The typical delay is about 30 minutes.
